intro: Sisyrinchium arguellesiae, commonly known as the Guanajuato blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats. It is a perennial species that thrives in full sun and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
